abstract.p: Letter by Thomas E Gilligan, president of Ancient Order of Hibernians in America, says that changing name of Royal Ulster Constabulary will not alter its 'despicable' record of rights abuses in Northern Ireland (S)

block.p: According to an Oct. 20 editorial, the Protestant community in Northern Ireland fears that the police reform bill before Parliament, which would change the name of the Royal Ulster Constabulary, would ''airbrush'' the R.U.C. from history. There is little chance of that.

We're confident that the despicable record of human rights abuses and official killing by the R.U.C. will stand the test of time. From the archives of Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch to the calendar of the European Court of Human Rights, the force's treachery is recorded.

For loyalists who desire a peace with justice, a fresh start on policing is not just desirable, but also a necessity.
THOMAS E. GILLIGAN National President Ancient Order of Hibernians in America Fort Lauderdale, Fla., Oct. 20, 2000
